title: How to Eat Soup Politely

steps.headline: Be seated at the table.
steps.description: If you are eating soup on the couch or somewhere else, be sure to use a Stable Table™ or a tray, to prevent it from slopping around and making a mess, or from burning you.

steps.headline: Place your serviette or napkin on your lap in case you spill anything.
Break up any bread or bread roll on the side plate next to you and eat it intermittently with the soup.
steps.description: See "Tips" for what not to do with bread and soup.

steps.headline: Pull the dish close to you to make sure you don't spill the soup while eating.
Have the correct spoon.
steps.description: A soup spoon is the best spoon to eat soup. Failing that, use a spoon larger than a teaspoon but smaller than a serving dish spoon.

steps.headline: Fill the spoon about three-quarter the way full.
steps.description: Do not overfill a soup spoon or it will spill as you lift it. Lift your spoon carefully and slowly from the bowl to your mouth.

steps.headline: Continue eating soup in this manner, methodically, slowly and with care.
steps.description: Always place the entire spoon into your mouth to prevent the need to slurp. Be careful not to clank it on your teeth.

steps.headline: As you near the end of the soup, tilt the bowl away from you and not towards you.
steps.description: This is considered the polite way to finish soup as there is much less risk of spilling the soup into your lap.

steps.headline: Rest the spoon in your bowl at the end and push the bowl away from you gently.

text: Be seated at the table. If you are eating soup on the couch or somewhere else, be sure to use a Stable Table™ or a tray, to prevent it from slopping around and making a mess, or from burning you. Place your serviette or napkin on your lap in case you spill anything.  Break up any bread or bread roll on the side plate next to you and eat it intermittently with the soup. See "Tips" for what not to do with bread and soup. Pull the dish close to you to make sure you don't spill the soup while eating.  Have the correct spoon. A soup spoon is the best spoon to eat soup. Failing that, use a spoon larger than a teaspoon but smaller than a serving dish spoon. Fill the spoon about three-quarter the way full. Do not overfill a soup spoon or it will spill as you lift it. Lift your spoon carefully and slowly from the bowl to your mouth. Continue eating soup in this manner, methodically, slowly and with care. Always place the entire spoon into your mouth to prevent the need to slurp. Be careful not to clank it on your teeth. As you near the end of the soup, tilt the bowl away from you and not towards you. This is considered the polite way to finish soup as there is much less risk of spilling the soup into your lap. Rest the spoon in your bowl at the end and push the bowl away from you gently.
